refnamediv.refpurpose: A date, time and timezone structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Struct to store date, time and timezone information altogether. GstDateTime is refcounted and immutable.
Date information is handled using the proleptic Gregorian calendar.
Provides basic creation functions and accessor functions to its fields.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_get_day ()
refsect2.para: Returns the day of the month of this GstDateTime. Call gst_date_time_has_day before, to avoid warnings.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_get_month ()
refsect2.para: Returns the month of this GstDateTime. January is 1, February is 2, etc.. Call gst_date_time_has_month before, to avoid warnings.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_get_hour ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the hour of the day represented by datetime in the gregorian calendar. The return is in the range of 0 to 23. Call gst_date_time_has_haur before, to avoid warnings.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_get_microsecond ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the fractional part of the seconds in microseconds represented by datetime in the gregorian calendar.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_get_minute ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the minute of the hour represented by datetime in the gregorian calendar. Call gst_date_time_has_minute before, to avoid warnings.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_get_time_zone_offset ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the offset from UTC in hours that the timezone specified by datetime represents. Timezones ahead (to the east) of UTC have positive values, timezones before (to the west) of UTC have negative values. If datetime represents UTC time, then the offset is zero.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the offset from UTC in hours

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_get_second ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the second of the minute represented by datetime in the gregorian calendar. Call gst_date_time_has_second before, to avoid warnings.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_get_year ()
refsect2.para: Returns the year of this GstDateTime Call gst_date_time_has_year before, to avoid warnings.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GstDateTime * gst_date_time_new (gfloat tzoffset, gint year, gint month, gint day, gint hour, gint minute, gdouble seconds);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstDateTime using the date and times in the gregorian calendar in the supplied timezone.
year should be from 1 to 9999, month should be from 1 to 12, day from 1 to 31, hour from 0 to 23, minutes and seconds from 0 to 59.
Note that tzoffset is a float and was chosen so for being able to handle some fractional timezones, while it still keeps the readability of representing it in hours for most timezones.
If value is -1 then all over value will be ignored. For example if month == -1, then GstDateTime will created only for year . If day == -1, then GstDateTime will created for year and month and so on.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

entry.para: the day of the gregorian month

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new_ymd ()
refsect2.programlisting: GstDateTime * gst_date_time_new_ymd (gint year, gint month, gint day);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstDateTime using the date and times in the gregorian calendar in the local timezone.
year should be from 1 to 9999, month should be from 1 to 12, day from 1 to 31.
If value is -1 then all over value will be ignored. For example if month == -1, then GstDateTime will created only for year . If day == -1, then GstDateTime will created for year and month and so on.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

entry.para: the day of the gregorian month

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new_ym ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstDateTime using the date and times in the gregorian calendar in the local timezone.
year should be from 1 to 9999, month should be from 1 to 12.
If value is -1 then all over value will be ignored. For example if month == -1, then GstDateTime will created only for year .
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new_y ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstDateTime using the date and times in the gregorian calendar in the local timezone.
year should be from 1 to 9999.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new_from_unix_epoch_local_time ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstDateTime using the time since Jan 1, 1970 specified by secs . The GstDateTime is in the local timezone.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new_from_unix_epoch_utc ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstDateTime using the time since Jan 1, 1970 specified by secs . The GstDateTime is in the UTC timezone.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new_local_time ()
refsect2.programlisting: GstDateTime * gst_date_time_new_local_time (gint year, gint month, gint day, gint hour, gint minute, gdouble seconds);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstDateTime using the date and times in the gregorian calendar in the local timezone.
year should be from 1 to 9999, month should be from 1 to 12, day from 1 to 31, hour from 0 to 23, minutes and seconds from 0 to 59.
If month is -1, then the GstDateTime created will only contain year , and all other fields will be considered not set.
If day is -1, then the GstDateTime created will only contain year and month and all other fields will be considered not set.
If hour is -1, then the GstDateTime created will only contain year and month and day , and the time fields will be considered not set. In this case minute and seconds should also be -1.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

entry.para: the day of the gregorian month, or -1
the hour of the day, or -1
the minute of the hour, or -1
the second of the minute, or -1

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new_now_local_time ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstDateTime representing the current date and time.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the newly created GstDateTime which should be freed with gst_date_time_unref().

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new_now_utc ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstDateTime that represents the current instant at Universal coordinated time.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the newly created GstDateTime which should be freed with gst_date_time_unref().

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_ref ()
refsect2.para: Atomically increments the reference count of datetime by one.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_unref ()
refsect2.para: Atomically decrements the reference count of datetime by one. When the reference count reaches zero, the structure is freed.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if datetime 's day field is set, otherwise FALSE

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if datetime 's month field is set, otherwise FALSE

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if datetime 's second field is set, otherwise FALSE

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if datetime 's hour and minute fields are set, otherwise FALSE

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if datetime 's year field is set (which should always be the case), otherwise FALSE

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new_from_iso8601_string ()
refsect2.para: Tries to parse common variants of ISO-8601 datetime strings into a GstDateTime. Possible input formats are (for example): 2012-06-30T22:46:43Z, 2012, 2012-06, 2012-06-30, 2012-06-30T22:46:43-0430, 2012-06-30T22:46Z, 2012-06-30T22:46-0430, 2012-06-30 22:46, 2012-06-30 22:46:43, 2012-06-00, 2012-00-00, 2012-00-30, 22:46:43Z, 22:46Z, 22:46:43-0430, 22:46-0430, 22:46:30, 22:46 If no date is provided, it is assumed to be "today" in the timezone provided (if any), otherwise UTC.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly created GstDateTime, or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_to_iso8601_string ()
refsect2.para: Create a minimal string compatible with ISO-8601. Possible output formats are (for example): 2012, 2012-06, 2012-06-23, 2012-06-23T23:30Z, 2012-06-23T23:30+0100, 2012-06-23T23:30:59Z, 2012-06-23T23:30:59+0100

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly allocated string formatted according to ISO 8601 and only including the datetime fields that are valid, or NULL in case there was an error. The string should be freed with g_free().

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_new_from_g_date_time ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstDateTime from a GDateTime object.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

entry.para: the GDateTime. The new GstDateTime takes ownership.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly created GstDateTime, or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: gst_date_time_to_g_date_time ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GDateTime from a fully defined GstDateTime object.
Free-function: g_date_time_unref

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly created GDateTime, or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: GstDateTime
refsect2.para: Opaque, immutable, refcounted struct that stores date, time and timezone information. It currently supports ranges from 0001-01-01 to 9999-12-31 in the Gregorian proleptic calendar.
Use the accessor functions to get the stored values.

refsect2.title: GST_TYPE_DATE_TIME
refsect2.para: a boxed GValue type for GstDateTime that represents a date and time.
